page.title: 01Confluence of Test & Itchen.
page.content: Our survey area was{Southampton Water at the confluence of the River Test and River Itchen.It included some land on the west bank of Test,opposite the {docks}and a larger area of land on the east bank of the Itchen,where the river flows into Southampton Water. This inland water has{"double"tides which give Southampton an advantage as a busy passenger and cargo port.The {sheltered inland waterway}has also been an influence on these industries and has further influenced the development of{shipbuilding}and {leisure activities}such as sailing and water sports in the area.The River Itchen is now spanned by a bridge providing an easy link between Woolston and Southampton.Until the bridge opened in June 1977 this river could only be crossed by a Floating Bridge.
